revised_title: The Impact of Maternal Age and Advances in Prenatal Diagnosis on Down Syndrome Incidence
tldr: This article discusses the relationship between advanced maternal age and the incidence of Down syndrome. It highlights the impact of prenatal diagnosis on reducing the number of cases born to mothers over 35 years old. The author also explores other factors, such as early diagnosis, survival of low-weight infants, and potential changes in the mutation rate, that may contribute to the overall incidence of Down syndrome.
